channel.title: Making any client compatible with server?
channel.description:
I understand that there's things that have to do with HexInts and stuff but I don't exactly know how everything works. Could someone give me a brief summary on how to make a client compatible with your server?
I'm trying to get different 317/377 clients to work with my server, but I haven't figured out how to.

item.title: Making any client compatible with server?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You have to make sure the packets (And packet sizes) are correct on both ends, and you need to make sure your NPC/Player updating is the same on both sides (size wise. If you have 12 bits on one end, 12 bits will be on the other).
(This is a PI, but an example)
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/tutorials/280556-pi-extending-npc-bits-server-side.html
See here that they’re extending the npc bits (To allow more data)… In your case, you’re just matching…
